headline: Ohio House passes resolution honoring US soldiers exposed to Agent Orange
author: Andrew Cass
sentences: The Ohio House of Representatives has unanimously passed a resolution honoring the 2.6 million American soldiers exposed to Agent Orange during the Vietnam War.
The U.S. Armed Forces used Agent Orange to destroy crops and vegetation between 1961 and 1971 as part of its herbicidal warfare program, Operation Ranch Hand.
During that 10-year period, more than 20 million gallons of Agent Orange were sprayed, exposing soldiers ...
